title: Baeckea uncinella
text:
Baeckea uncinella is a shrub found along the south coast <a href="Western%20Australia">Western Australia</a>.
It is found along the edges of <a href="salt%20lake">salt lake</a>s, saline creeks and <a href="salt%20pan%20%28geology%29">salt pan</a>s in the coastal parts of the <a href="Goldfields-Esperance">Goldfields-Esperance</a> region of Western Australia in a small area centred around <a href="Esperance%2C%20Western%20Australia">Esperance</a> where it grows in sandy or clay loam soils.
The shrub typically grows to a height of . It blooms between October and November producing white flowers.
The species was first formally described by the <a href="botanist">botanist</a> George Bentham in 1867 in the work "<a href="Flora%20Australiensis">Flora Australiensis</a>".
